alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 04 at 5:54AM MDT until November 04 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Higher amounts of a foot or more possible on west facing high peaks near the Colorado border. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will create areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Jemez Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama and Chuska Mountains. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Check road conditions before heading out.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
